summary: This bill, the "Setting Consumer Standards for Lithium-Ion Batteries Act," mandates the Consumer Product Safety Commission (CPSC) to establish safety standards for lithium-ion batteries used in consumer products, specifically referencing ANSI/CAN/UL standards. It requires the CPSC to adopt existing standards within 180 days and outlines a process for reviewing and potentially incorporating future revisions to these standards. The bill also mandates a report to Congress on hazards related to these batteries within five years of enactment.
